Header: Heavy snow hampers search for skiers believed missing in Norway avalanche
Content: Poor weather conditions and heavy snowfall were hampering the search for four skiers who disappeared following an avalanche in Arctic Norway. The avalanche took place in the northern Norwegian region of Troms and three Finns and a Swede who were skiing in the area were reported missing to police. Police spokesman Andreas Nilsen said it might take several days for rescue services to be able to properly search the area, and that preparations were being made to receive relatives of the missing skiers who are making their way to Troms.
